news_header: Three network experienced a major outage affecting 999 calls, now resolved but warned of further issues due to Storm Éowyn.
news_text: The mobile network Three reported that during a major outage, some 999 emergency calls failed to connect, impacting thousands of customers. The issue has been resolved, but further disruptions are expected due to Storm Éowyn. Customers expressed frustration over missed calls and appointments, and the regulator Ofcom is investigating the incident. Three has around 10.5 million customers in the UK, and it remains unclear how many were affected. Compensation for the outage is uncertain, although it may be appropriate for refunds during repairs.
